definition: to wash the face and rinse the mouth
to rinse one's mouth with water/to gargle

sentences.english: We were haled into the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 我们被强行拖进了洗漱间。

sentences.english: A third in the bathroom might even be a good idea, Matlen says.
sentences.chinese: 当然在洗漱间放一个也是个好主意。

sentences.english: I shower, clean up, do my hair.
I take my time waking up, but then I wash up quickly.
sentences.chinese: 我花了一些时间起床，然后很快地洗漱完毕。

sentences.english: Al dia, ellos se asean en el patio.
sentences.chinese: 他们每天在院子里洗漱。

sentences.english: Early one morning I saw the Mute Singer washing himself at the river.
sentences.chinese: 一天上午的早些时候，我看见沉默的歌手在河边洗漱。

sentences.english: For the safety, the lavatories have to be closed prior to landing.
sentences.chinese: 为了您的安全，在飞机着陆之前洗漱间关闭。

sentences.english: Wash eat breakfast read the plan of our work day .
sentences.chinese: 洗漱，吃早餐，阅读工作日计划。

sentences.english: Clothe, wash the , and go out.
There are washrooms in every carriage of the train for passengers to wash their faces and rinse their mouths.
sentences.chinese: 火车上的盥洗室设在每节车厢之间，供旅客洗漱使用。

sentences.english: No inns where they could refresh themselves.
sentences.chinese: 也没有可以更衣洗漱的旅店。

sentences.english: The appliance that wash gargle can be put on its mesa, the cabinet below still can be put sundry .
sentences.chinese: 它的台面上可放洗漱用具，下面的柜子还能放杂物。

sentences.english: Yes, there is a washroom at the end of each carriage.
sentences.chinese: 有，在每节车厢的末端都有洗漱间。

sentences.english: After that, he washes and brushes, and tidies up his room.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她洗漱，并整理他的房间。

sentences.english: Like the L'Occitane toiletries in the bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里的洗漱用品都是欧莱雅的。

sentences.english: At home, I wash in warm water from the faucet.
sentences.chinese: 在家的时候，我用水管中的温水洗漱。

definition: to make oneself presentable/to freshen up
to rinse the mouth and wash the face
to get out of bed/to get up
to go to sleep/to go to bed (literary)
to put in order/to tidy up/to pack/to repair/(coll.) to sort sb out/to fix sb
to change clothes/to go to the toilet (euphemism)
